name: overmedicated
text: A comment left by overmedicated was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sevenarts, cryptfiend85, Methadone)

name: nurdbot
text: Ray really needs to find a better escort service, or demand Tina to french him once more.

name: dusty
text: Incidentally Till You French Me Once More was one of his hit love ballads.

name: ravindra108
text:
He's not talking to an escort service. He's talking to whomever is keeping track of all the year's sex positions (because he would hire someone for that).
He said he's going to be alone in the bathroom with the water running, which we know from this strip means he'll not be using an escort.


I know this reply is 3 years late, but I'm saying it anyway.

name: whuppins
text: Just saying the words isn't enough for Ray. He has to go all Wayne Newton while he does it.

name: johnnyrocker
text:
I imagine that, since he's doing it for a year, he says the words a little differently each day.
Maybe one day, a little Wayne Newton. Another day he's just laying on the couch muttering? I don't know man I'm outta gas.

name: nielj
text: One day with his fingers as a small handlebar moustache and speaking in a subtle british accent?

name: lizjones
text: I enjoy the slight overlap of dong over moon.

name: djwhiterabbit
text: isn't Dong Over Moon a special at denny's?

name: lizjones
text: Steven the waiter: Dong Over Moon? That's a really good one!

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: Who is he on the phone with?  Teodor?

name: rad_chillies
text: My thoughts exactly....  perhaps it's just an imaginary person monitoring his daily sex position experiment

name: connellingus
text: I imagine it's his publisher, since I assumed the challenge would also entail writing a book as did the chick in New York.

name: laserblade
text: His mom?

name: molesticide
text: it's the guinness world records people, of course.  they have strict rules about this kind of thing, like how lifting one leg up constitutes a different sex position than not lifting that leg up.  what?

name: jollysaintpete
text: what does the guinness world records have to do with this?

name: letterswewrote
text:
did anyone else think of this when they saw the moon panel?

http://images.google.com/imgres?imgurl=http://www.sonypictures.com/classics/sweetandlowdown/images/title.jpg&imgrefurl=http://www.sonypictures.com/classics/sweetandlowdown/django.html&h=441&w=239&sz=35&hl=en&start=7&um=1&tbnid=zo5NPbBMK8gZNM:&tbnh=127&tbnw=69&prev=/images%3Fq%3Dsweet%2Band%2Blowdown%26svnum%3D10%26um%3D1%26hl%3Den%26safe%3Doff%26client%3Dfirefox-a%26rls%3Dorg.mozilla:en-US:official%26sa%3DN

name: honesttom
text: Nope, I'd only just seen the movie when this strip was posted, and found the coincidence delightful.

name: xiaomimi
text: My mom has a picture of, I think, my great-grandmother sitting on a similar structure.  People in the twenties just loved sitting on crescent moons!  I wish I knew the context of her being photographed sitting on a moon, but it's all a mystery now.

name: arbys
text:
I find it somewhat unlikely that a multibillionaire like Ray would find it impossible to find women to fuck.

Are there no cat gold-diggers?

name: stuart
text: ...ALWAYS run the sink if you think I might be home...

name: cpnglxynchos
text: is it a thing to run the water when wanking?

name: woodenteeth
text: You tyrant. Oh man. That last panel makes this one of my favourite in that subtle kinda way.

name: confusion
text: "Sassafrass." I think that's the first (presumably) unintentional misspelling I've seen in Achewood - which actually has to count as a compliment to Onstad or whoever does his proofreading.

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
Man, I was buying cat food for my ridiculously finicky cat the other day, and came across a can of "Shrimp and Salmon with Aspic" cat food.

That shit was nasty-looking, but kitty liked it...

Until he puked on my bed.

name: tekende
text: Nah, he still liked it even then.

name: tad-
text: Saying every word in the dictionary over a period of a year is such an awesome idea. Someone should do it and record it, even just as an elaborate tribute to this comic.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
I'm pretty sure this was the first achewood I read, since it was referenced in a Salon article, so I had to shlep over to get away from the relentless Salon pissing & moaning about the latest Bush White House horrors.

I'm thinking immediately <"This guy is weird and funny, and I don't really get this. I like that in a cartoonist." >

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
So, anyways...I think the chick was a bit creeped that Onstad had done a strip referencing her....and she said so.
Well, flash-forward, ..they made a movie about it, dint they? It's a chick-flick with Meryl Streep as Julia, and some cute Gen-X actress as the Julie.
And I think the actress did a good job portraying her as a boring mutt who basically siphons from the legend to feed her blog.
I told you all that to tell you this:
it was ironic to me that she got her knickers in a twist about Onstad putting her in this cartoon!

no moral!

name: philophobe
text: Clearly, feats of quotidian derring-do are an heritable trait of the Smuckles bloodline .

name: cpnglxynchos
text: NOT A VALID DATE.

name: thegreatestcape
text:
*Ahem*

THE GODDAMN SMUCKLES BLOODLINE
